intro: Oenanthe megapolitana, commonly known as the Mediterranean cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its slender stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Oenanthe megapolitana typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
